page.title: 19TRADITIONS FROM BALBY
page.content: It is amazing what customs and traditions a 9 year old can uncover just by talking to the people around the area. Having talked to many people Ihave discovered that: It was traditional for Balby people to take a weeks holiday in September during what was called 'race week'. Every man, woman and child went to Doncaster Race Course to picnic, visit the fair and watch the races. The main race is the St. Leger. Many people still carry on theis tradition. In Balby on Sandford Rd. there is a field called Tuby's Field where an annual feast or fair was held. Mr. Tuby was a fair ground owner and let his field be used . There were stalls, games and amusements. It was held on a fine day in July but sadly the fair no longer meets here.
